itec.minicompiler
Class ErrorHandler

java.lang.Object
  itec.minicompiler.ErrorHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConstantsInterface
public class ErrorHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements ConstantsInterface

The ErrorHandler implements the actions that have to be done when an error occurs. These are the generation and the output of an error message using the error code given to the ErrorHandler. The error code itself is defined in the ConstantsInterface.

An error message consists of 4 parts:

  • the type of error (LEX for lexical errors, SYN for syntactical errors, SEM for semantical errors)
  • the position of the error (defined by line and column in the source code)
  • the error message for the particular error
  • a suggestion for a solution for the problem

    • Seperately the number of errors the ErrorHandler dealt with are count and can be displayed.

    Version:
    1.0 (29.09.2004)
    Author:
    Stefan Leitner, Stefan Schauer

    getErrorCounter

    public int getErrorCounter()

    Returns:
    The total number of errors

    error

    public void error(int n,
                  int line,
                  int column)
    Generate and display the error message for the error number n.

    An error message consists of 4 parts:

  • the type of error (LEX for an error occured during the lexical analysis)
  • the position of the error (defined by line and column in the source code)
  • the error message for the particular error
  • a suggestion for a solution for the problem

    • The error message is displayed at the standard output device (by System.out.print).

    Parameters:
    n - internal number of the error (defined in ConstantsInterface)
    line - row in the source code where the error occured
    column - column in the source code where the error occured

    printErrors

    public void printErrors()
    Print the total number of errors reported by the ErrorHandler on the standard output device (by System.out.print).
